docs.snippet: Mr. Mankoff will be replaced by Emma Allen after a 20-year run. He plans to write more cartoons for the magazine....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Mankoff will be replaced by Emma Allen after a 20-year run. He plans to write more cartoons for the magazine.

headline.main: Bob Mankoff to Step Down as Cartoon Editor of The New Yorker
headline.print_headline: New Yorker’s Mankoff Plans to Step Down

docs.snippet: Mayor Karen Weaver has told the Environmental Protection Agency that more corrosion control studies have to be done and Flint will need more than two years before the city can begin to supply its own water....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Karen Weaver has told the Environmental Protection Agency that more corrosion control studies have to be done and Flint will need more than two years before the city can begin to supply its own water.

headline.main: Flint: More Corrosion Control Studies on Water Needed
headline.print_headline: Flint: More Corrosion Control Studies on Water Needed

docs.snippet: A former JPMorgan Chase & Co employee who has been ordered to attend counselling for gambling has pleaded guilty to criminal charges that he stole more than $5 million from his employer to pay personal debts, New York prosecutors said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former JPMorgan Chase & Co employee who has been ordered to attend counselling for gambling has pleaded guilty to criminal charges that he stole more than $5 million from his employer to pay personal debts, New York prosecutors said.

headline.main: Ex-JPMorgan Employee Pleads Guilty to $5 Million Fraud
headline.print_headline: Ex-JPMorgan Employee Pleads Guilty to $5 Million Fraud

docs.snippet: Britain's smaller companies are hoarding cash and cutting investment, bankers say, a sign of business confidence starting to wobble as the government sets off down the uncertain path of leaving the European Union....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's smaller companies are hoarding cash and cutting investment, bankers say, a sign of business confidence starting to wobble as the government sets off down the uncertain path of leaving the European Union.

headline.main: Britain's Small Companies Hoard Cash as Brexit Looms
headline.print_headline: Britain's Small Companies Hoard Cash as Brexit Looms

docs.snippet: Uber Technologies Inc said on Thursday it plans to comply with California regulations and seek permits to put its self-driving cars back on the state's roads, an about-face following the company's legal spat with state officials in December....
docs.lead_paragraph: Uber Technologies Inc said on Thursday it plans to comply with California regulations and seek permits to put its self-driving cars back on the state's roads, an about-face following the company's legal spat with state officials in December.

headline.main: Uber Says to Seek Permit to Restart Self-Driving Pilot in California
headline.print_headline: Uber Says to Seek Permit to Restart Self-Driving Pilot in California

headline.print_headline: Mystery Odor Sends Workers to Hospital for 2nd Time in Week

docs.snippet: Tens of millions of dollars in royalties and signing bonuses that Glencore told an independent transparency board it had paid to Congo's state mining company actually went to a business controlled by Israeli billionaire Dan Gertler, advocacy group...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tens of millions of dollars in royalties and signing bonuses that Glencore told an independent transparency board it had paid to Congo's state mining company actually went to a business controlled by Israeli billionaire Dan Gertler, advocacy group Global Witness said in a report on Friday.

headline.main: Mining Royalties Glencore Said Were for Congo Went to Israeli Billionaire
headline.print_headline: Mining Royalties Glencore Said Were for Congo Went to Israeli Billionaire

docs.snippet: Following a practice which dates back to imperial times, hundreds of thousands of petitioners from across China stream into Beijing each year in the hope that their grievances, often spawned by local officials, will be rectified once central autho...
docs.lead_paragraph: Following a practice which dates back to imperial times, hundreds of thousands of petitioners from across China stream into Beijing each year in the hope that their grievances, often spawned by local officials, will be rectified once central authorities are made aware of their plight.

headline.main: Rare Disclosure Sheds Light on Plight of China's Aggrieved Petitioners
headline.print_headline: Rare Disclosure Sheds Light on Plight of China's Aggrieved Petitioners

docs.snippet: Japan's core consumer prices rose for the first time in over a year in January due to a pickup in energy costs and private consumption, offering some hope for the central bank's efforts in accelerating inflation to its 2 percent target....
docs.lead_paragraph: Japan's core consumer prices rose for the first time in over a year in January due to a pickup in energy costs and private consumption, offering some hope for the central bank's efforts in accelerating inflation to its 2 percent target.

headline.main: Japan's Core Inflation Rises for First Time in Over a Year
headline.print_headline: Japan's Core Inflation Rises for First Time in Over a Year
